snippet: Editoriale Zanardi, a prestige book printer, was brought to its knees by the economic crisis. But employees invested their unemployment and severance payments to create a cooperative and start producing again.
abstract: Padua Journal; workers at prestige book printer Editoriale Zanardi in Padua, Italy, pooled resources and bought company after it hit hard times following economic crisis in Europe; Zanardi's workers represent many throughout Europe who hope their specialized artisanal work will give them unique niche in globalized marketplace, though some experts say odds are that such businesses will not survive long.
lead_paragraph: Editoriale Zanardi, a prestige book printer, was brought to its knees by the economic crisis. But employees invested their unemployment and severance payments to create a cooperative and start producing again.

headline.main: Italian Artisans’ Revival After Economic Crisis Reflects Resilience of Small Industry
headline.print_headline: Pouring Souls, and Cash, Into a Fading Craft
